subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Amazon Dieback
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Amazon Dieback usable.

hook.text: The Amazon produces much of its own rain. Trees pump moisture into clouds above.

buildup.text: Leaves release water vapor that forms clouds, which fall as rain on neighboring trees.

discovery.text: Deforestation breaks the cycle. Fewer trees mean less rain, which kills more trees.

twist.text: Losing 20-25% of the Amazon could trigger irreversible dieback of the whole forest.

climax.text: About 17% has already been cleared. The tipping point may be only years away.

punchline.text: The forest that makes its own rain could forget how.

quiz.question: How much of the Amazon has already been cleared?
